main event: Multiple witnesses, including Civilian Air Patrol personnel, reported seeing red lights over Greenwood, Mississippi on July 15, 1952. The objects maneuvered from 'cover' to 'high speed'.
interesting points: The objects had three large red lights grouped together and an unidentified aircraft silhouette was seen behind the lights.
The objects were observed over Greenwood and Greenville, Mississippi, with pilots of aircraft in the area also reporting sightings.
The objects were described as maneuvering at high speeds, stopping abruptly, and making sharp turns.
Ground-based witnesses reported the objects were bright enough to read by and emitted radiant heat.
The sightings lasted for around 20 minutes before the objects disappeared.
sighted object: red lights, with an unidentified aircraft silhouette
witnesses: Civilian Air Patrol, ground-based observers, and pilots of aircraft in the area
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
